Incident.Summary: The suspect is prohibited from possessing firearms and attempted to voluntarily register a Privately Manufactured Firearm.

IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText: This incident was captured on MSP issued Body Worn Camera. On August 8, 2023 MT Pouncey #4207 of MSP Licensing Division completed a Firearms Registration Unit Disapproval (#2023F481) for Matthew Austin Duley (W/M, DOB: 11/30/1998) for a voluntary registration application. Duley attempted to register a privately manufactured firearm, identified as a Polymer80 PF940C 9mm (S/N: 85212877-1511). Duley was found to be prohibited from possessing firearms as he is under thirty years of age and was adjudicated juvenile delinquent for a disqualifying crime. Further investigation found the adjudication was sustained as delinquent on 04/13/2023 through Charles County Department of Juvenile Services for Assault Second Degree (Complaint ID # 11-12328). Duley was confirmed to be prohibited and a copy of the DJS complaint indicating such was obtained. Duley had no firearms listed in MAFSS. This case was assigned to me, ST S. DiToto #5416, for further action. The subsequent investigation utilizing multiple law enforcement resources and social media revealed no further leads. The status of the firearm Duley attempted to register remained outstanding. There was no information to indicate further possession or access to firearms. On September 5, 2023 at approximately 0628 hours, SGT D. Feltman #0915 and I conducted a knock and talk at Duleys residence at 8307 Croom Road, Upper Marlboro, Prince Georges County, Maryland. Investigators contacted Duleys girlfriend, Mikayla Noelle Baldwin, at the residence. Baldwin advised Duley had already left for work and she was not aware of any firearms in the residence. Duley contacted Baldwin via telephone while investigators were on scene. I then established direct phone contact with Duley. Duley advised he was at work but would make arrangement to surrender the firearm as soon as possible. He advised he purchased and manufactured the firearm prior to implementation of new laws regulating privately manufactured firearms in Maryland as of March 2023. Duley stated he originally purchased the Polymer80 kit at a gun show in Virginia. Duley advised no firearms were stored at his residence and all stored at his parents residence. Duley further advised he owned two non-regulated rifles that he purchased from Freds Outdoors. It was decided to transfer the two rifles via Freds Outdoors to Duleys mother, Melissa Duley. Melissa Duley is not prohibited from possessing firearms. On September 5, 2023 at approximately 1338 hours, Matthew Duley met ST S. DiToto at MSP Prince Frederick Barrack, 210 Main Street, Prince Frederick, Maryland, and surrendered the Polymer80 PF940C 9mm (S/N: 85212877-1511). Duley was provided with a MSP Form 203 (Firearms Disposition) and MSP Form 67 (Chain of Custody). The firearm was stored pending disposition. On September 7, 2023 at approximately 1215 hours, I contacted Melissa Duley and confirmed the firearms will be transferred to her via All Pawn and Guns on September 9, 2023 and are stored secure in her residence until that time. There was no further information to indicate Matthew Duley possessed firearms or was in violation of Maryland Firearms Laws. I contacted Prince Georges County States Attorneys Office Firearms Unit and after review it was decided not to pursue prosecution. Case closed prosecution declined. Above events occurred Prince Georges County, Maryland.

IncidentProperty.Description: Polymer80 PF940C 9mm S/N:852128771511 w/ "Glock 19" Style slide with optic
